TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UserTrackingRecord extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingRecord

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains the data sent to a tracking service by the runtime tracking infrastructure when a is matched.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile>, it sends a UserTrackingRecord to the tracking service over the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingChannel> associated with that tracking service. The tracking service can perform whatever action is required on the data in the tracking record.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: public UserTrackingRecord (Type activityType, string qualifiedName, Guid contextGuid, Guid parentContextGuid, DateTime eventDateTime, int eventOrder, string userDataKey, object userData);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type activityType, string qualifiedName, valuetype System.Guid contextGuid, valuetype System.Guid parentContextGuid, valuetype System.DateTime eventDateTime, int32 eventOrder, string userDataKey, object userData) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> of the activity associated with the user event.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> of the activity associated with the user event.
A number that identifies the of the activity associated with the user event.
A number that identifies the of the parent activity of the activity associated with the user event.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that indicates the date and time of the user event associated with the tracking record.
The relative order in which the user event associated with this tracking record occurred in the workflow instance.
A key associated with the user data for this tracking record, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The user data associated with the user event.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified parameters.
Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) type of the activity that emitted the user data for which this was created.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Type> of the activity that emitted the user data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of annotations associated with the user event.
Docs.value: A that contains the annotations that are associated with the user event by the that was matched in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can specify annotations to be associated with a user event in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Annotations%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint>, it returns these annotations in Annotations.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.
## Examples For more information about annotations, see the [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a280199c-3000-4148-ac63-cb5aaeac07c8) and the [Using the Tracking Profile Object Model Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/0b820e0a-8f4b-4276-8452-e985b51d9528).

Docs.summary: Gets a list containing any additional data extracted from the workflow for the that was matched.
Docs.value: A list of objects each of which contains a single piece of extracted data and its associated annotations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> is matched, the runtime tracking infrastructure can extract data from the workflow instance. The data to be extracted is specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Extracts%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Extracts%2A?displayProperty=fullName> can contain <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityDataTrackingExtract> objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the activity associated with the user event, and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowDataTrackingExtract> objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the root activity of the workflow. Each type of extract can also specify annotations to be returned with the extracted data. The runtime tracking infrastructure encapsulates each piece of extracted data and its associated annotations in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> which it adds to Body.
Because the user data pushed to the tracking service by the user event is contained in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserData%2A>, Body will frequently be an empty list. This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.value: A number that identifies the context of the activity.

MemberSignature.Value: public override EventArgs EventArgs { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Always a null reference ( in Visual Basic) for a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks There is no event data associated with a user event, therefore, EventArgs has no meaning and is always a null reference (`Nothing`).
The user data that is pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%2A> methods that caused the user event is sent in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserData%2A>. Any data extracts that are associated with the user event by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> are encapsulated in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> objects and sent in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Body%2A>.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: public override DateTime EventDateTime { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date and time that the user event occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.DateTime> is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int EventOrder { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the order of the user event that matched the in the workflow instance.
Docs.value: A value that indicates the order of the user event in the workflow instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks EventOrder indicates the order of the user event that matched the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> relative to the other tracking events emitted by the workflow instance. EventOrder will be unique within a workflow instance, but it is not guaranteed to be sequential.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.value: A number that identifies the context of the parent activity.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the qualified name of the activity associated with this .
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> of the from which the user data for this user event was emitted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the user data for this user event.
Docs.value: The user data for which the was created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks UserData contains the actual data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the overloaded <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%2A> methods is responsible for the user event.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a key associated with the user data for this .
Docs.value: A key associated with the user data for this tracking record.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An activity or workflow designer can use either <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName> to specify a key to associate with the user data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure. UserDataKey contains this key. If no key is specified, UserDataKey is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
